docs.snippet: Top-seeded Jose-Luis Clerc of Argentina, getting better as the tournament progresses, registered a 7-5, 6-2 victory over Manuel Orantes of Spain in the quarterfinals of the $175,000 United States Pro tennis championships today.   Unheralded Bernard...
docs.lead_paragraph: Top-seeded Jose-Luis Clerc of Argentina, getting better as the tournament progresses, registered a 7-5, 6-2 victory over Manuel Orantes of Spain in the quarterfinals of the $175,000 United States Pro tennis championships today. Unheralded Bernard Fritz of France upset 10th-seeded Jose-Luis Damiani of Uruguay, 6-4, 6-1, and Hans Gildemeister of Chile overcame a brief attack of heat exhaustion to beat Angel Gimenez of Spain, 6-4, 1-6, 6-3. The other quarterfinal match, between Eliot Teltscher and Ricardo Cano of Argentina, was rained out tonight and rescheduled for tomorrow morning. Clerc will face the winner of that match tomorrow night, and Fritz will play Gildemeister in the other semifinal.

docs.snippet: Pascal Portes, a 22-year-old Frenchman, upset Harold Solomon, 1-6, 6-3, 6-2, and reached the third round of the $200,000 Washington Star tennis tournament today.   Victor Pecci of Paraguay was also upset, losing to Diego Perez of Uruguay, 7-5, 6-1....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pascal Portes, a 22-year-old Frenchman, upset Harold Solomon, 1-6, 6-3, 6-2, and reached the third round of the $200,000 Washington Star tennis tournament today. Victor Pecci of Paraguay was also upset, losing to Diego Perez of Uruguay, 7-5, 6-1. Ivan Lendl and Jose-Luis Clerc won, as did Eddie Dibbs.

headline.main: SOLOMON AND PECCI UPSET IN 2D ROUND

docs.snippet: To the Editor:    Jose Pertierra asks why he needs a license to read certain Cuban journals (letter July 15). He deserves an answer, but first a resume of the pertinent law:   On the basis of a resolution adopted at a meeting of the Foreign Ministers...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Jose Pertierra asks why he needs a license to read certain Cuban journals (letter July 15). He deserves an answer, but first a resume of the pertinent law: On the basis of a resolution adopted at a meeting of the Foreign Ministers of the Organization of American States at Punte Del Este, Uruguay, President Kennedy issued Presidential Proclamation 3447 on Feb. 3, 1962. Pursuant to that proclamation, Treasury Secretary Dillon issued first the Cuban Import Regulations, effective Feb. 7, 1962, and then, on July 8, 1963, the Cuban Assets Control Regulations, which have been in effect ever since. Their purpose was to ban all trade with Cuba by citizens and residents of the United States, thus depriving Cuba of U.S. funds and products.

headline.main: WHY THE U.S. KEEPS TRACK OF CUBAN JOURNALS

docs.snippet: Jose Luis Clerc and Guillermo Vilas of Argentina scored opening-round victories today at the Volvo international tennis tournament.   The third-seeded Clerc won his 14th straight match with a 7-6, 6-2 victory over Pascal Portes of France.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jose Luis Clerc and Guillermo Vilas of Argentina scored opening-round victories today at the Volvo international tennis tournament. The third-seeded Clerc won his 14th straight match with a 7-6, 6-2 victory over Pascal Portes of France.

headline.main: CLERC AND VILAS WIN OPENING VOLVO MATCHES

docs.snippet: Ocean Venture '81, a naval exercise starting today and scheduled to last two and half months, is the most ambitious test undertaken by the Navy in many years. It will emphasize the scope of United States maritime commitments and the fleet's reliance...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ocean Venture '81, a naval exercise starting today and scheduled to last two and half months, is the most ambitious test undertaken by the Navy in many years. It will emphasize the scope of United States maritime commitments and the fleet's reliance in a war on its allies, both inside and outside the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. Some allies, notably the Norwegians, have shown reluctance to take part in the exercise. Their reason is that the first phase of the operation, which takes place in the South Atlantic, appears to extend NATO's role beyond the area stipulated in the North Atlantic Treaty.

headline.kicker: U.S. AND ALLIED NAVIES STARTING MAJOR TEST TODAY

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: ARMS CONTROL AND LIMITATION AND DISARMAMENT

docs.snippet: Gen. Gregorio Alvarez, a retired Commander in Chief of the Uruguayan army, was today named the next President of Uruguay, the first military man to fill that position under the present regime.   His designation was formalized today by a vote of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. Gregorio Alvarez, a retired Commander in Chief of the Uruguayan army, was today named the next President of Uruguay, the first military man to fill that position under the present regime. His designation was formalized today by a vote of the National Council, a body made up of the regime's senior military men and civilian legislative advisers.

headline.main: Uruguay Names General As Next President

byline.original: Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Jeane J. Kirkpatrick, whose ideas on authoritarian Governments in Latin America were provocative when she was a professor at Georgetown University, is leaving few doubts on her current tour that her views have not changed.   In a press conference...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeane J. Kirkpatrick, whose ideas on authoritarian Governments in Latin America were provocative when she was a professor at Georgetown University, is leaving few doubts on her current tour that her views have not changed. In a press conference yesterday she said that psychoanalysis of Cuba's Fidel Castro would be needed to understand his motives and she accused the Soviet Union of expansionism and of propagating ''oneparty dictatorships.'' In an interview later she defended the Reagan Administration's moves to improve relations with the military Governments in Argentina, Chile, Uruguay and Brazil, saying that they had ''more elements of constitutionalism'' than many countries do. At the same time, she said she had raised concerns with Argentine officials about the nearly 900 political prisoners held in jail here without charges, although she sidestepped a question in the press conference about whether she also sought an accounting of the more than 6,000 people who have reportedly disappeared in the hands of state security forces.

headline.main: LATINS GET TASTE OF KIRKPATRICK STYLE

byline.original: By EDWARD SCHUMACHER, Special to the New York Times

docs.snippet: Top-seeded Andrea Jaeger defeated Sue Barker, 6-1, 6-7, 6-2, today and advanced to a semifinal meeting with third-seeded Mima Jausovec in the United States Open Clay Court tennis championships.   In a late third-round match, Jose-Luis Clerc of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Top-seeded Andrea Jaeger defeated Sue Barker, 6-1, 6-7, 6-2, today and advanced to a semifinal meeting with third-seeded Mima Jausovec in the United States Open Clay Court tennis championships. In a late third-round match, Jose-Luis Clerc of Argentina, the defending champion, defeated Andres Gomez of Ecuador, 7-5, 6-3. The victory moved Clerc into the quarterfinal round tomorrow against Mel Purcell, seeded fifth.

headline.main: Miss Jaeger Gains; Clerc Beats Gomez

docs.snippet: Top-seeded Andrea Jaeger defeated Mima Jausovec, 6-3, 6-1, today to advance to the final of the United States Open Clay Court tennis championships.   Miss Jaeger, runner-up here a year ago, will face Virginia Ruzici of Rumania.
docs.lead_paragraph: Top-seeded Andrea Jaeger defeated Mima Jausovec, 6-3, 6-1, today to advance to the final of the United States Open Clay Court tennis championships. Miss Jaeger, runner-up here a year ago, will face Virginia Ruzici of Rumania.

headline.main: Misses Jaeger and Ruzici Gain Clay Court Final

docs.snippet: Colombia announced today that it had agreed to send an infantry battalion to the Sinai Peninsula to participate in an international peace force recently agreed to by Israel and Egypt.   The unit is to be in place by late April 1982.
docs.lead_paragraph: Colombia announced today that it had agreed to send an infantry battalion to the Sinai Peninsula to participate in an international peace force recently agreed to by Israel and Egypt. The unit is to be in place by late April 1982.

headline.main: Colombia Agrees to Send Battalion for Sinai Force
